719260f-a.text:
Delancey Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of
Forsyth Street.
About 1914.
Joseph P. Day.
Neag. ~158.
719260f-a.folder: Delancey Street & Forsyth Street, Manhattan, NY

719257f-a.text:
(1)
Delancey Street, at, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of Forsyth Street. Also shown, is Forsyth Street, west side, north fron Delancey, to and including East Houston Streets. These buildings will be completely demolished to form a portion of the site of the
Sarah Delano Roosevelt Park.
July 18, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a later date.

P. L. Sperr.
719257f-a.folder: Delancey Street & Forsyth Street, Manhattan, NY

719776f-b.text:
(1)
Forsyth Street, east side, at Delancey Street, as seen from Chrystie Street, and across clearance. Shown at the S.E. corner of Forsyth and Delancey Streets, is the Beth Ha-Knesseth Poalei 7edek Anshei Olia
Synagogue.
99s d P2W9 ocwoer 12. 930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A portion of the same view from a different angle, and showing
a closer view of the synagogue.
NE ~ 338S  September 24, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same as No. 2 at a later date, and showing in the foreground the
completed Sarah Delano Roosevelt Park.

719261f-a.text:
DDelancey Street, north sidc, east from, but not including Forsyth Street. Note the Second Ave., Elevaped on Allen Street.
April 30, 1936.
P L. Sperr.
719261f-a.folder: Delancey Street & Forsyth Street, Manhattan, NY

719262f-a.text:
(1)
Delancey Street, south side, east from and including Forsyth Street, to, but not including Eldridge Street. The view also shows Forsyth Street. at and adjoining the S.E. corner of Delancey Street. The view also
shows a Jewish Synagogue.
NEe6 ~ 33E  February 14, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a different angle. Note clearance on the right.
July 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, a closer view of the Beth Ha-E'nesseth Poalei 2edek Anshei
Olia Synague.
AEG : 2902 september 21, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
